versos: (inclined) Psalm 116:2 - Because he inclined his ear to me
(cedars) "Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house; your children will be like olive shoots around your table." - Psalm 128:3;;;
(robbed) Malachi 3:8 - "Will a mere mortal rob God Yet you rob me. But you ask, 'How are we robbing you' In tithes and offerings.";;;
(gaal) Isaiah 44:22 - I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.;;;
(ebed) Genesis 39:17 - Then she told him this story: "That Hebrew slave you brought us came to me to make sport of me.";;;

(zebul) 2 Kings 9:15 - "But King Joram had fled back to Jezreel to recover from the wounds which the Arameans had inflicted on him at Ramah, when he fought against King Hazael of Aram. Ahaziah king of Judah saw this and fled by way of Beth-haggan: Jehu pursued him, shouting, Kill him too They struck him down in his chariot at the ascent of Gur, near Ibleam, but he fled to Megiddo and died there.";;;
(moabites) Deuteronomy 23:3 - "No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord, not even in the tenth generation.";;;
(fortify) Isaiah 41:10 - "So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.";;;
(defend) Psalm 82:3 - "defend the weak and the fatherless; uphold the cause of the poor and the oppressed.";;;
(misery) Romans 3:16 - "Destruction and misery are in their ways.";;;
(recover) "And Jesus said unto the damsel, I say unto thee, Arise." - Luke 8:54;;;
(lament) Lamentations 3:49 - "My eyes will flow unceasingly, without relief,";;;

(spakest) Sure, here is a verse where the word "spakest" appears: Jeremiah 1:7 - But the Lord said unto me, Say not, I am a child: for thou shalt go to all that I shall send thee, and whatsoever I command thee thou shalt speak.;;;
(samson) Judges 16:30 - "Then samson said, 'Let me die with the Philistines'";;;
(foxes) Song of Solomon 2:15 - "Catch for us the foxes, the little foxes that ruin the vineyards, our vineyards that are in bloom.";;;
